sense.name: look at or observe something or someone
sense.commentary:
Syntax is: NP1 WATCH (NP2)
Note: Compare this group to the group 3. In this group, the watcher cannot exert control over the patient. Physical and metaphorical act of looking and paying attention.
sense.examples: Are you coming to watch the game? I watched him as he walked off down the street. I wasn't watching for him. I got the feeling I was being watched. They won't let me watch tv tonight. Watch how the dog chases the cat away. I watch the market every day.

sense.name: be alert for an anticipated/possible event
sense.commentary:
Syntax includes: NP1 WATCH[intransitive] (out) PP(for + event)
Note: Keep attention or monitor in order to accomplish or prevent something. Doesn't necessarily have to do with the act of physically looking. Includes: WATCH OUT
sense.examples: Watch out for the pickpockets! Your job is to watch for anyone coming. Please watch for the opportunity to volunteer for this group.

sense.name: monitor closely with authority and control
sense.commentary: Syntax is: NP1 WATCH NP2 Attention for control or protective measure. NOTE: NP1 has implied control over NP2, but unlike sense 4, there is observation, and not necessarily action taken Includes: WATCH OVER
sense.examples: Can you watch the baby while I go upstairs? The shepherd watched the flock white llamas. He watched the prisoner all day. It's your turn to watch the camp tonight. Please watch over my stuff while I go to the restroom.

sense.name: actively control, manage
sense.commentary:
Syntax is: NP1[agent] WATCH NP2
Note: To exert control by taking care of or keeping mindful of something.
sense.examples: Watch your language! Watch where you are going! I need to watch my weight. Watch what you are doing with your knife.
